de.esoco.gwt.server

Class AuthenticatedServiceImpl<E extends de.esoco.entity.Entity>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.servlet.GenericServlet
      • javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
        • com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.AbstractRemoteServiceServlet
          • com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.RemoteServiceServlet
            • de.esoco.gwt.server.CommandServiceImpl
              • de.esoco.gwt.server.AuthenticatedServiceImpl<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.google.gwt.user.client.rpc.RemoteService, com.google.gwt.user.server.rpc.SerializationPolicyProvider, de.esoco.data.SessionManager, AuthenticatedService, CommandService, de.esoco.lib.net.ExternalServiceAccess, java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StorageServiceImpl

    public abstract class AuthenticatedServiceImpl<E extends de.esoco.entity.Entity>
extends CommandServiceImpl
implements AuthenticatedService, de.esoco.data.SessionManager, de.esoco.lib.net.ExternalServiceAccess
    Implementation of AuthenticatedService. The generic parameter defines the entity type that is used to perform the authentication on (typically some type of person entity).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getCurrentSession

        public de.esoco.data.SessionData getCurrentSession()
        Returns the SessionData for the current session or NULL if no user is authenticated for the current request. Other than getSessionData() this method will not throw an authentication exception if no user is authenticated but return NULL instead.
        Returns:
        The session data if a user is authenticated for the current request or NULL for none

                                         throws AuthenticationException

      • authenticate

        protected abstract E authenticate(de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement rLoginData)
                           throws AuthenticationException
        Must be implemented by subclasses to perform the authentication of a user. The returned object must be the authenticated entity that corresponds to the given credentials if the authentication was successful. The input is a string data element with the login name as it's name and the password as the value.
        Parameters:
        rLoginData - A string data element containing the login credentials
        Returns:
        The entity of the authenticated person if the authentication was successful
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If the authentication fails

      • getServiceConfiguration

        protected abstract org.obrel.core.ProvidesConfiguration getServiceConfiguration()
        This method must be implemented by subclasses to return a configuration object for this service. This must be an implementation of the interface ProvidesConfiguration.
        Returns:
        The service configuration entity

      • addLogAspect

        protected void addLogAspect(de.esoco.lib.logging.LogAspect<?> rLogAspect)
        Adds a log aspect to the logging framework after injecting the session manager (i.e. _this_ instance) into it.
        Parameters:
        rLogAspect - The log aspect to add

      • authorizeUser

        protected void authorizeUser(E rUser,
                             de.esoco.lib.property.HasProperties rLoginData)
                      throws AuthenticationException
        Performs the authorization of a user after authentication. What exactly this means depends on the subclass implementation and is application dependent. This default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rUser - The authenticated user
        rLoginData - Additional properties from the login data if available
        Throws:
        AuthenticationException - If the authorization fails

      • changePassword

        protected void changePassword(de.esoco.data.element.StringDataElement rPasswordChangeRequest)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Can be implemented by subclasses to support password changes for the current user. The string data element parameter contains the old password as it's name and the new password as it's value. The implementation must not assume the old password to be correct but instead it MUST always validate it before performing the password update. The default implementation does nothing.
        Parameters:
        rPasswordChangeRequest - A data element containing the password change request
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Any exception may be thrown if the password change fails

      • endSession

        protected void endSession(de.esoco.data.SessionData rSessionData)
        This method can be overridden by subclasses that need to perform cleanup operations if a session is no longer needed. The superclass method should always be invoked after a subclass has performed it's cleanup.
        Parameters:
        rSessionData - The session data for the session that is logged out

        Throws:

      • initUserData

        protected void initUserData(de.esoco.data.element.DataElementList rUserData,
                            E rUser,
                            java.lang.String sLoginName)
                     throws ServiceException
        This method can be overridden by subclasses that need to provide additional informations in the user data that is sent back to the client. Subclasses must always invoke the superclass method to inherit the standard user data.

        Because it is possible for clients to re-login with different parameters implementations should always expect the user data element to already contain data and therefore to not always add values but to update them if necessary.

        Parameters:
        rUserData - The list of data elements for the current user
        rUser - The entity for the user to initialize the data from
        sLoginName - The login name of the current user
        Throws:
        ServiceException - If initializing the data fails

      • processDownloadRequest

        protected boolean processDownloadRequest(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest rRequest,
                                         javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse rResponse,
                                         de.esoco.data.SessionData rSessionData)
        Checks for and if necessary processes a download GET request.
        Parameters:
        rRequest - sUrl The request URL
        rResponse - The servlet response
        rSessionData - The session data for the current user
        Returns:
        TRUE if a download request has been detected and processed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO operation fails
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If handling the request fails

      • processExternalServiceResponse

        protected boolean processExternalServiceResponse(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest rRequest,
                                                 javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse rResponse,
                                                 de.esoco.data.SessionData rSessionData)
                                          throws javax.servlet.ServletException
        Checks for and if necessary processes a download GET request.
        Parameters:

        rResponse - The servlet response
        rSessionData - The session data for the current user
        Returns:
        TRUE if a download request has been detected and processed
        Throws:
        javax.servlet.ServletException - If handling the response fails

      • resetSessionData

        protected void resetSessionData(de.esoco.data.SessionData rSessionData)
        Resets an existing session data for re-use. This method will be invoked if a user connects again to a session, e.g. after closing the browser window. Subclasses can then reset the session data, like removing stale data that cannot be used again.

        Subclasses should always invoke the superclass implementation.

        Parameters:
        rSessionData - The session data to reset
